TopicTitle: [1.1.2] KSPRC - Renaissance Compilation: artworks remake [V-0.7 Pre Release 3]

Articles.Content:
Quote

Most likely cause for duplicating Kerbals is KIS (Kerbal Inventory System) and KKS (KerbalKrashSystem) not playing nicely together.

Thanks for your answer,

The only mods I use are the KSPRC ones and also Engineer Redux. Actually I noticed that this bug is more specific than I thought: it only occurs when I perform an EVA in space high over the Sun. EVAs work normally in space around Kerbin, as well as landed at Kerbin and Minmus ( I haven't tried other locations). Would it help if I upload the output_log.txt file?

Edited July 5, 2016 by Shaal
Quote

1 minute ago, atomontage said:

Its in the original post. SO many dudes just ignore it.

That post wasnt ignored, its 2 years old and alot can change in that time. And also the reason im asking is actually because of that post and i didnt want to read 123 pages to see if anything has changed as yet as the post states...... " Probably can be adapted without much trouble, but it has not been designed for it, and is not contemplated atm. If you play RSS and want to adapt it, please, share the results to reach as many people as possible. "

I was wondering if it has been adapted yet hence my question "is it working out of the box"

Hey Proot, I just want to commend you on the amazing work you've done here for graphic junkies and casual KSP players alike. Keep up the good work!

I have two  questions though, keep in mind my pc is slow and about eight years old, so one of the questions I'm asking may be answered in the mod itself. Unfortunately,  I can't answer it considering my rig's processing power. 

1.) Do you think you'll ever try experimenting with volumetric auroras, instead of just a pretty, flat texture that spins around the poles, having the Aurora Borealis and Australis actually have a depth to them as they do here below?

2.) Do you recommend just plugging in the 1.1.3 version of Kopernicus into KSPRC or waiting until you update KSPRC itself. I'm not very knowledgeable when it comes to modding so I don't know if there's a difference between the Kopernicus in the KSPRC .zip file and the main Kopernicus mod itself.

Edited July 6, 2016 by HereComesTheBoom
Forgot a question

Hello!

This mod is absolutely epic, so I am not complaining, knowing that this is still prerelease etc.

Anyway I landed a probe on Eve and as I landed I started running into a series of visual weirdness. First of all the transition between the "orbital scene" and "ground scene" was really really rough.
It was almost as if the whole planet suddenly changed color from one shade of purple to a totally different shade of purple. The cloud layer only appeared on very low altitudes (around 2500 meters or so).
When I got through the bottom cloud layer, then the land below me was constantly flickering between ocean and land (eventually solved this with alt+enter). The latter is probably a scatterer issue.

When landed it seems that the bottom cloud layer is only rendered immediately on top of the landed craft. Maybe I can somehow configure the render distance? 
Currently it sort of gives a cartoonish impression like there is a rain cloud constantly following my craft =). 

So main question is: Is it supposed to be like this at the moment, or has something gone borked?

On 28/06/2016 at 7:30 AM, Silent1_87 said:

Are u guys getting snow ball kerbin bug too since 1.1.3 i think its sccater fault but im not sure maybe Kopernicus. 

 

On 28/06/2016 at 7:51 AM, SmashBrown said:

Yup i'm getting it on the start menu.

I'm getting it in game too, seems to be becoming increasingly annoying. Sometimes when I jump back to the space centre and back again it fixes.

I am trying to adapt the mod to RSS, which includes adding geysers to certain other objects. However, my question at the moment is what defines a landClass? Take, for instance, BaseBeach, what does it mean? Is it mapped to the beaches biome or what? This is the hardest part at the moment, the rest should be fairly easy.

On 27/06/2016 at 0:16 AM, mystershow said:

Hello everyone!

Since 1.1.3, it seems like KSRPC doens't load the terrain texture anymore. Or at least I am unable to see bushes, trees or rocks.

I tried to launch KSRPC alone on a fresh install but I have the same issue.

The rest seems to work as well as before. Keep on the good work!

I seem to have a similar issue. Kopernicus up to date, terrain scatters enabled.
is this mod avaible on CKAN ? i dont have 1.1.2 install so i ask for 1.1.2 users

Ah well, good to know it's not just me then. I do not have the high quality textures anymore either.

12 hours ago, AlimOncul said:

is this mod avaible on CKAN ? i dont have 1.1.2 install so i ask for 1.1.2 users  

No, but from what I've managed to look into, it could be, since all the mods that KSPRC configures use ModuleManager and so could have their existing configs modified by KSPRC. Obviously though that's a lot of work.

You need more mods

yeah, but I figured I should play a stockalike game. Cut back a bit, you know.

The USI stuff is more stockalike than stock is, anyway.

Hi, has anyone here had an issue where all ground textures are extremely dark? I've tested it on Moho and Eeloo and once I get close enough to the surface that the ground textures start to render over the map view texture, the ground is extremely dark - not quite black, but something you would expect at dusk even at midday. I've tried reinstalling, I'm just curious if anyone else has had the same problem? I'm running 1.1.2 and all I've done on that copy of KSP is install RSPRC. Thanks

Edited July 13, 2016 by Speadge
Anyone know where the grass/terrain textures are stored? I want to make the grass in Kerbinside match.

Question about Kopernicus: Is it normal for these small, reddish plants to appear scattered throughout the grasslands?

They seem like underwater plants. I kind of wonder if they unintentionally replaced trees because of a glitch in my installation.

I don't know where it is, i just dropped KSPRC in, so I don't have a handle on it's function yet, however you likely have one or more errors in your CFG files, as it causes errors with sigma binary.

If I remove KSPRC (but leave the it's dependencies), the error goes away.

Request @Proot, on your next release could you possibly give us te option of low, medium and hi resolution clouds, as beautiful as your mod is, my poor 670 gpu just doesnt like them and the fps drops considerably, thanks proot, can't play ksp without your work.
